title: M&S launches drive to boost menswear shoppers - Retail Gazette
summary:
- M&S is launching a strategic initiative to increase menswear sales, aiming to convert male customers who primarily visit for food into clothing shoppers.
- CEO Stuart Machin has set a goal for the menswear division, led by Mitch Hughes, to match the success of the womenswear line this autumn.
- The retailer plans to introduce 200 new menswear options this year, featuring bolder styles and innovative fabrics, including stretch and crease-resistant suits.
- M&S has seen a growth in menswear market share from 9.9% to 10.4%, with a notable increase in formal wear sales, selling 585,000 suits last year.
- The brand is also enhancing its reputation for inclusivity by introducing stoma underwear for men, reflecting a broader trend towards diverse product offerings in retail.
